node.title: Student loan changes could bring millions closer to shedding debt, Education Dept. says
node.description: A review found some servicers had been placing borrowers facing financial difficulties into forbearance instead of giving them clear information about income-driven repayment options.

node.title: Jury awards family of man mistakenly declared dead $1.5 million.
node.description: Frankie Kerrigan later showed up to visit one of "his" pall bearers.

node.title: Large majority favor legal recreational marijuana under federal law
node.description: Most Americans are not opposed to having legal marijuana businesses in their area.

node.title: Ukrainian commander in Mariupol pleads for help
node.description: Ukrainian troops said the Russia's military dropped heavy bombs to flatten what was left of a steel plant believed to be the key port city's defenders' last holdout.

node.title: John McLaughlin on Russia's world-changing war - "Intelligence Matters"
node.description: Host Michael Morell speaks with former CIA Deputy Director John McLaughlin about global implications of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

node.title: Trooper arrested for 2020 fatal shooting of Black driver after chase
node.description: After a high-speed chase, Connecticut state trooper Brian North fired seven shots into a car that had been driven by alleged carjacker Mubarak Soulemane. The car was surrounded by police cruisers at the time.

node.title: Taiwan TV station apologies after mistakenly saying China was invading
node.description: Chinese Television System (CTS) sparked alarm admitted its false alarm "caused public panic." Taiwan's 23 million people live under constant threat of an invasion by China.

node.title: Prince Harry says he is making sure the Queen is protected
node.description: The Duke Of Sussex has revealed the Queen was "on great form" during their recent meeting - as he describes making sure she is "protected".

node.title: Demand for materials driving record hike in building costs
node.description: Almost 49,800 dwellings were consented in the year ended February but there's growing concern the industry cannot keep up with that level of demand.

node.title: Missing merino sheep 'Shrekapo' gets his first shear
node.description: A woolly merino sheep is feeling much lighter now after four years on the run in the Tekapo hills. Afternoons chats to the owner of Sawdon Station where Shrekapo now resides. Audio

node.title: Lifting of US mask mandate may be appealed - Biden administration
node.description: A US judge's ruling to end mask mandates on aeroplanes will be appealed if health officials say the mandates are necessary to slow Covid-19, the Biden administration says.

node.title: Ramos-Horta takes commanding lead in Timor-Leste's presidential election
node.description: The independence leader and Nobel laureate Jose Ramos-Horta previously served as prime minister, then as the country's second president from 2007 to 2012.

node.title: Daily catch limits aim to combat overfishing
node.description: Daily catch limits for all finfish in New Zealand waters will come into effect next month.

node.title: One dead after residential fire in Ōtāhuhu
node.description: One person has died following a residential fire on Māngere Road in the Auckland suburb of Ōtāhuhu this morning.

node.title: Solomon Islands-China security deal should be made public says Kenilorea
node.description: Solomon Islands has gone ahead and signed a controversial security agreement with China despite major resistance from local political figures, as well as neighbours Australia and New Zealand.

node.title: 'It's just spend spend spend': Govt approach adding to inflation woes - Luxon
node.description: The National Party leader says the government is addicted to spending and is making inflation worse. Audio

node.title: 'I just want him back': Niece desperate to bring missing fisherman home
node.description: Whānau of a missing fisherman will continue looking for him when the police search ends.

node.title: Russia unleashes 'Battle of Donbas' in east Ukraine, seizes city
node.description: Russian troops seized a frontline Ukrainian city on Tuesday, hours after starting a long-anticipated offensive in eastern Ukraine that the Kyiv government has called the Battle of the Donbas.

node.title: 'A turbulent time ahead': Global dairy prices on a downward slide
node.description: It is the third consecutive auction that prices have been lower at a time when Fonterra has more product on the platform.

node.title: Ambulance officer killed in Canterbury crash
node.description: A man killed in a crash in Christchurch last night was an off-duty St John ambulance officer.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 547 people in hospital, 14 in ICU
node.description: There are 11,217 Covid-19 community cases and 13 deaths today, the Ministry of Health says.

node.title: 'Putting on hold your life': 30-month wait and still no visa
node.description: Immigration New Zealand is being blamed for restricting how many migrant workers, students and visitors can come into the country.

node.title: Plenty of experience in Black Ferns Sevens squad
node.description: The Black Ferns Sevens coaches have drawn on plenty of experience as the side prepares to return to the World Series after an absence of more than two years.

node.title: Millennials, Gen Z put off major financial decisions because of student loans, study finds
node.description: Despite their student debt, only 10% said in retrospect they would skip higher education.

node.title: Trump pushes back against New York Attorney General's contempt effort
node.description: An attorney for Donald Trump said he does not have any of the documents sought by New York Attorney General Letitia James.

node.title: National opposing live animal export ban at select committee
node.description: Parliament's Primary Production Select Committee is split on whether live animal exports by sea should be banned.

node.title: Missing 14yo girl found
node.description: Police have found the 14-year-old girl in Canterbury who went missing on Saturday.

node.title: 'It's been busier than Christmas' - bach bookings boosted over Easter
node.description: Bach bookings over Easter were higher than they've been in years, as holiday makers took the opportunity of a long, fine weekend at Orange to get out and about.

node.title: 'You feel a little bit less cautious' - Parents, kids adjusting to orange setting
node.description: The orange light setting has brought a sense of relief for parents, as the eased restrictions mean one less thing to juggle - but some Covid-related worries are still lurking.

node.title: Southern drought : Farmers 'notorious for putting animal welfare in front of their own health'
node.description: Farmer welfare is a serious concern in Southland after the driest start to a year on record, the Southland Rural Support Trust says.
